meanings.definition: To make a promise that exceeds the capabilities or intentions of another.
meanings.sent1: She outpromised her friend by saying she would finish the project in one day.
meanings.sent2: He always outpromised his classmates with grand plans for the school event.
meanings.sent3: The little girl outpromised her brother that she would catch a unicorn for him.
meanings.sent4: The politician outpromised his opponent with extravagant pledges during the campaign.
meanings.sent5: The magician outpromised the audience by claiming he could make an elephant disappear.

meanings.sent1: The salesman outpromised his competitors by offering a lifetime warranty.
meanings.sent2: She outpromised everyone at the party by promising to bring the best dessert.
meanings.sent3: The cat outpromised the dog that it would catch more mice by the end of the week.
meanings.sent4: The company outpromised its previous record by committing to plant a tree for every product sold.
meanings.sent5: The student outpromised the teacher by vowing to complete all assignments ahead of schedule.
